title: Error in ClassLoadingDuringJobExecutionTest
body:
**Describe the bug**
When the test is executed in the integration test phase, the following error is thrown:

```
[ERROR] Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 5.006 s <<< FAILURE! -- in org.operaton.bpm.integrationtest.functional.classloading.jobexecution.ClassloadingDuringJobExecutionTest
[ERROR] org.operaton.bpm.integrationtest.functional.classloading.jobexecution.ClassloadingDuringJobExecutionTest.shouldLoadBPMNErorClassUsedInGroovyScriptDuringJobExecution -- Time elapsed: 0.112 s <<< ERROR!
org.operaton.bpm.engine.ProcessEngineException: ENGINE-09003 Could not parse 'process.bpmn'. Verarbeitungsanweisungsziel, das "[xX][mM][lL]" entspricht, ist nicht zulÃ¤ssig.
        at org.operaton.bpm.operaton-engine@1.0.0-beta-4-SNAPSHOT//org.operaton.bpm.engine.impl.util.EngineUtilLogger.parsingFailureException(EngineUtilLogger.java:54)
        at org.operaton.bpm.operaton-engine@1.0.0-beta-4-SNAPSHOT//org.operaton.bpm.engine.impl.util.xml.Parse.execute(Parse.java:149)
        at org.operaton.bpm.operaton-engine@1.0.0-beta-4-SNAPSHOT//org.operaton.bpm.engine.impl.bpmn.parser.BpmnParse.execute(BpmnParse.java:354)
        at org.operaton.bpm.operaton-engine@1.0.0-beta-4-SNAPSHOT//org.operaton.bpm.engine.impl.bpmn.deployer.BpmnDeployer.transformDefinitions(BpmnDeployer.java:104)
        at org.operaton.bpm.operaton-engine@1.0.0-beta-4-SNAPSHOT//org.operaton.bpm.engine.impl.AbstractDefinitionDeployer.transformResource(AbstractDefinitionDeployer.java:100)
        at org.operaton.bpm.operaton-engine@1.0.0-beta-4-SNAPSHOT//org.operaton.bpm.engine.impl.AbstractDefinitionDeployer.parseDefinitionResources(AbstractDefinitionDeployer.java:75)
        at org.operaton.bpm.operaton-engine@1.0.0-beta-4-SNAPSHOT//org.operaton.bpm.engine.impl.AbstractDefinitionDeployer.deploy(AbstractDefinitionDeployer.java:65)
        at org.operaton.bpm.operaton-engine@1.0.0-beta-4-SNAPSHOT//org.operaton.bpm.engine.impl.persistence.deploy.cache.CacheDeployer.lambda$deploy$0(CacheDeployer.java:46)
        at org.operaton.bpm.operaton-engine@1.0.0-beta-4-SNAPSHOT//org.operaton.bpm.engine.impl.interceptor.CommandContext.runWithoutAuthorization(CommandContext.java:551)
        at org.operaton.bpm.operaton-engine@1.0.0-beta-4-SNAPSHOT//org.operaton.bpm.engine.impl.interceptor.CommandContext.runWithoutAuthorization(CommandContext.java:539)
        at org.operaton.bpm.operaton-engine@1.0.0-beta-4-SNAPSHOT//org.operaton.bpm.engine.impl.persistence.deploy.cache.CacheDeployer.deploy(CacheDeployer.java:44)
```

The assumption is, that the XML was made invalid by migrating the inline-defined `process` String variable to a multiline string
author: javahippie

comments.body: Fixed

title: Using Springs ObjectUtils requires referencing Spring in Wildfly Modules
body:
**Describe the bug**
In an earlier change, we introduced Springs ObjectUtils and StringUtils in the Operaton code to call `isEmpty()` as a convenience method. Unfortunately this requires WIldfly to reference Spring in the modules (a change we did for the Distro already).

When running the integration tests, the following error can be seen:

```
[ERROR] Tests run: 1, Failures: 0, Errors: 1, Skipped: 0, Time elapsed: 6.573 s <<< FAILURE! -- in org.operaton.bpm.integrationtest.functional.bpmnmodelapi.RepositoryServiceBpmnModelRetrievalTest
[ERROR] org.operaton.bpm.integrationtest.functional.bpmnmodelapi.RepositoryServiceBpmnModelRetrievalTest.shouldReturnBpmnModelInstance -- Time elapsed: 0.177 s <<< ERROR!
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/springframework/util/ObjectUtils
        at org.operaton.bpm.operaton-engine@1.0.0-beta-4-SNAPSHOT//org.operaton.bpm.engine.impl.cmd.GetDeploymentBpmnModelInstanceCmd.<init>(GetDeploymentBpmnModelInstanceCmd.java:47)
        at org.operaton.bpm.operaton-engine@1.0.0-beta-4-SNAPSHOT//org.operaton.bpm.engine.impl.RepositoryServiceImpl.getBpmnModelInstance(RepositoryServiceImpl.java:335)
        at deployment.test.war//org.operaton.bpm.integrationtest.functional.bpmnmodelapi.RepositoryServiceBpmnModelRetrievalTest.shouldReturnBpmnModelInstance(RepositoryServiceBpmnModelRetrievalTest.java:53)
        at java.base/java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:568)
        at deployment.test.war//org.jboss.arquillian.junit.Arquillian$8$1.invokeMethod(Arquillian.java:325)
        at deployment.test.war//org.jboss.arquillian.junit.MethodInvoker$1.invoke(MethodInvoker.java:18)
        at deployment.test.war//org.jboss.arquillian.container.test.impl.execution.LocalTestExecuter.execute(LocalTestExecuter.java:57)
        at java.base/java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:568)
```

I'd argue that having to add Spring as a module in WIldlfy is not worth the benefit of using these methods. We could copy them into our codebase in accordance to Springs license, if possible, or write our own.


**To Reproduce**
Run `mvn clean install -Pengine-integration,wildfly,h2 -f qa` on the project root

**Expected behavior**
The integration tests should work
author: javahippie

comments.body:
The error still remains.

```
[ERROR] Failures:

[ERROR]   FailedJobCommandTest.testJobRetriesDecremented_multiple:62 expected:<50> but was:<52>
[ERROR]   TimerRecalculationTest.testTimerRecalculationBasedOnProcessVariable:63 expected:<1> but was:<2>
[ERROR] Errors: 
[ERROR]   TestWarDeploymentWithDiagram.testDeployProcessArchive:50 Â» NoClassDefFound org/springframework/util/ObjectUtils
[ERROR]   TestWarDeploymentWithDiagram.testInvoiceProcess:57 Â» NoClassDefFound org/springframework/util/ObjectUtils

[ERROR]   RepositoryServiceBpmnModelRetrievalTest.shouldReturnBpmnModelInstance:53 Â» NoClassDefFound org/springframework/util/ObjectUtils
[ERROR]   CdiBeanCaseTaskResolutionTest Â» Deployment Cannot deploy pa1.war: {"WFLYCTL0062: Composite operation failed and was rolled back. Steps that failed:" => {"Operation step-1" => {"WFLYCTL0080: Failed services" => {"org.operaton.bpm.platform.process-application-module.\"pa1.war\".DEPLOY.pa" => "java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/springframework/util/StringUtils
    Caused by: java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/springframework/util/StringUtils
    Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.springframework.util.StringUtils from [Module \"org.operaton.bpm.operaton-engine\" version 1.0.0-beta-4-SNAPSHOT from local module loader @5ad10c1a (finder: local module finder @6bb75258 (roots: /Users/kthoms/Development/git/github/operaton/qa/wildfly-runtime/target/server/wildfly-33.0.1.Final/modules,/Users/kthoms/Development/git/github/operaton/qa/wildfly-runti
```

title: chore: Fix blocker sonar issues in test code
body:
Add assertions to tests lacking them where they make sense. Add `@Test(expected = None.class)` to indicate when only the absense of an exception is required.

relates to: #88
author: ArneDeutsch

comments.body:
@ArneDeutsch Please be careful when referencing annotations in PR/issue descriptions. This tags users. The users `@test` and `@override` are often accidently linked.
You have to use backticks.

title: chore: "collapse" nested ifs
body: Resolves Sonar Issues
author: WoSchmo

comments.body: @WoSchmo I have rebased your branch and resolved the findings

title: harmonize startup and shutdown scripts for run, wildfly and tomcat (related to #383)
body: It works for the .bat files on windows. The run and tomcat .sh files do not work with gitbash on windows. Neither in the old version nor in the version of this PR (wildfly works with this setup). So please verify the scripts on linux or mac.
author: WoSchmo

comments.body: Thanks @WoSchmo, I'll check on Mac

The start scripts are working.

But please change the output of the version. Currently it prints:
```
./start.sh --version
Project version: 1.0.0-beta-3-SNAPSHOT
```

Comparing to typical outputs:
```
ruby --version
ruby 2.6.10p210 (2022-04-12 revision 67958) [universal.arm64e-darwin24]

git --version
git version 2.48.0

jreleaser --version
jreleaser 1.16.0
```

I think the outputs should read better this way:
```
./start.sh --version
Operaton 1.0.0-beta-3-SNAPSHOT
Operaton 1.0.0-beta-3-SNAPSHOT (Tomcat 10.1.30)
Operaton 1.0.0-beta-3-SNAPSHOT (Wildfly 33.0.1.Final)
```
The first is the "Run" distro.
Thanks for the suggestions. I just pushed the changes.


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to the root of the product on CLI (probably happens only on specific Windows (?) environments)..
2. Execute './mvnw'

**Expected behavior**
Full build succeeds without error.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Windows 11
 - Operaton-Version: Latest from head.
author: ArneDeutsch

comments.body: Thanks for opening this one. Let's see how we can fix that. I don't have a Windows machine here.
Can you please add information about the JDK you are using for building?

After a fist look, my guess is that your `operaton.deploymentDir` is null, which is passed in `OperatonBpmRunConfiguration` line 67. I don't have a reason or solution, yet, just wanted to document here.

title: chore: remove unused dependencies
body:
I have removed several dependencies. Please take your time and review if those are not neccesary otherwise!

related to #167
author: WoSchmo

comments.body:
Thanks @WoSchmo. I will need a while to check this. I'm a bit unsure regarding dependencies that are depending on distributions. The default build does not check all profiles and engine integration tests are not yet enabled.

On first sight, it looks ok.

This was a bit too aggressive. The "run" distro for example fails with
```
Caused by: java.io.FileNotFoundException: class path resource [org/springframework/web/servlet/config/annotation/WebMvcConfigurer.class] cannot be opened because it does not exist
```

To verify, build and run the distros and see if at least tasklist is working as expected.
@kthoms @WoSchmo Just checking if the latest comment still stands and this PR should be closed without merging it?
Thank you for the reminder!

title: Replace parent dependency from operaton-database-settings to operaton-parent
body:
**Describe the bug**
Many modules have declared `operaton-database-settings`, which itself has `operaton-parent` as parent.

Many of them do not need the database specific profiles of that POM, so they could have `operaton-parent` as parent.

**To Reproduce**
Search for `operaton-database-settings` in `pom.xml` files.

**Expected behavior**
Modules that safely can have `operaton-parent` should change their parent.

Please think carefully about unwanted side effects.
author: kthoms

comments.body: I picked it up.

```
Error:    BatchRestServiceInteractionTest Â» ServerBootstrap Unable to bootstrap server: Address already in use
```
Can you try and re-run the pipeline? Maybe this is an issue with flaky tests?
It seems that i have no permission to do so
Ah, my bad. I restarted the job

title: Fix instanceof check and cast with pattern matching in engine. (#85)
author: dirk-olmes

comments.body: lgtm!

title: Adjusting the Sonarqube Quality Gate
body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
We are often changing existing code, which does not have a lot of coverage. While the overall code coverage is good, many of our merge requests are being displayed as "failed", because we edit code which would not neccessarily benefit from code coverage, e.g. data classes.

My proposal is to check the code coverage not for new code, but globally, so our build history does not look like it is failing all the time, raising impressions of sloppy work.
author: javahippie

comments.body: @kthoms @a-m-zill @hauptmedia Opinions on this?

Iâ€™ve noticed that the pipeline is currently always marked as â€œred,â€ and I believe this creates a negative first impression of the project. It can be misleading, especially considering that all of the over 30,000 tests are being executed successfully. This doesnâ€™t seem to accurately reflect the projectâ€™s overall health.

I suggest reviewing the pipeline settings to better align with the projectâ€™s success criteria.

At this moment it is quite likely that we fail the criteria. For example, I just changed a single line of source in source/main amongst a ton of changes in tests, and Sonar made this fail the quality gate as the single line was not covered by a test (=> 0% coverage). I have ignored this fact and just merged.

Also there could be that one change is degrading the code quality, but I'm cleaning this up with later changes.

For now I would be OK to lower the quality gate, but once we are done with the cleanups we should enforce that again. Definetely before the 1.0.0 Final version.
I removed the coverage for now.

title: Harmonize artifact names
body:
Used naming rules:
- Each name starts with `Operaton -`  optionally followed by a grouping name, e.g. `Spring Boot Starter -`
- Start names with capital letter, e.g. "engine" -> "Engine"
- Use capital letters only for acronyms, e.g. CDI, HTTP, POM, BOM, XML, SOAP
- Separate Jakarta with - Jakarta

The resulting reactor name output is (sorted for better overview, Maven will print in unsorted order)

```

[INFO] Operaton - Assert                                                  [jar]
```
